member.summary: Generates a value with the specified number of digits.

member.returns: A new value.

member.name: M:Spackle.SecureRandom.GetByteValues(System.UInt32,Spackle.ValueGeneration)
member.summary: Gets an array of random values.
member.param: The number of random elements to get.
Specifies if the values should be unique.
member.returns: Returns an array of random values.
member.exception: Thrown if exceeds the maximum value of a and is equal to Unique.
member.remarks: If is equal to , then the value of should be small relative to . The closer the ratio of numberOfElements/byte.MaxValue is to 1, the longer it will take for GetByteValues to produce a unique random set of values.

member.name: M:Spackle.SecureRandom.GetDoubleValues(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Gets an array of random values.
member.param: The number of random elements to get.
member.returns: Returns an array of random values.

member.name: M:Spackle.SecureRandom.GetInt32Values(System.UInt32,Spackle.ValueGeneration)
member.summary: Gets an array of random values.
member.param: The number of random elements to get.
Specifies if the values should be unique.
member.returns: Returns an array of random values.
member.exception: Thrown if exceeds the maximum value of an and is equal to Unique.
member.remarks: If is equal to , then the value of should be small relative to . The closer the ratio of numberOfElements/int.MaxValue is to 1, the longer it will take for GetInt32Values to produce a unique random set of values.

member.name: M:Spackle.SecureRandom.Next
member.summary: Gets a random value.
member.returns: Returns a new random value between 0 (inclusive) and Int32.MaxValue (exclusive).

member.summary: Gets a random value.

member.returns: Returns a new random value between 0 (inclusive) and (exclusive).
member.exception: Thrown if is less than zero.

member.summary: Gets a random value.
member.param: The lower bound of the generated random number.
The upper bound of the generated random number.
member.returns: Returns a new random value between (inclusive) and (exclusive).

member.name: T:Spackle.RandomObjectGenerator
member.summary: Allows a user to create random values of a specified type. This class provides default implementations for a number of types. The user can also provide a hook to handle the generation of any time - this also allows the user to override the default implementations.

member.summary: Creates a new instance.

member.name: M:Spackle.RandomObjectGenerator.#ctor(System.Random)
member.summary: Creates a new instance that uses a specific instance.

member.summary: Generates a value for the specified type.
member.typeparam: The type to generate a value for.
member.returns: Returns a random value of type .

member.name: M:Spackle.RandomObjectGenerator.Generate``1(System.Collections.Generic.SortedSet{``0})
member.summary: Generates a value for the specified type that is not in a specified list of values.
member.typeparam: The type to generate a value for.
member.param: A set of values that should not be generated.
member.returns: Returns a random value of type .

member.summary: Generates a value for the specified type, using the callback to generate specific values.
member.typeparam: The type to generate a value for.
member.param: The hook to invoke for any encountered type in the value generation process.
member.returns: Returns a random value of type .

member.summary: Generates a value for the specified type that is not in a specified list of values, using the callback to generate specific values.
member.typeparam: The type to generate a value for.
member.param: The hook to invoke for any encountered type in the value generation process.
A set of values that should not be generated.
member.returns: Returns a random value of type .
member.exception: Thrown if either or are null.

member.name: T:Spackle.Extensions.ICommunicationObjectExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods to close/abort a -based reference correctly.
member.remarks: The following two links provide a wealth of detail on the issue and why these Use extension methods are provided: http://www.infoq.com/news/2009/03/WCF-Dispose and http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/forums/en-US/wcf/thread/b95b91c7-d498-446c-b38f-ef132989c154/

member.name: M:Spackle.Extensions.ICommunicationObjectExtensions.Use(System.Object,System.Action)
member.summary: Allows a user to run a unit of work that would use a -based reference and close or abort the channel correctly.
member.param: The that will use the channel.

member.name: M:Spackle.Extensions.ICommunicationObjectExtensions.Use``1(System.Object,System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Allows a user to run a unit of work that returns a value that would use a -based reference and close or abort the channel correctly.
member.param: The that will use the channel.
member.typeparam: The type of the return value.
member.returns: A value returned from .

member.name: M:Spackle.Extensions.TypeExtensions.GetRootElementType(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the root element type for a given .
member.returns: Returns the root element .
member.remarks: Certain types (e.g. arrays and byrefs) have an element type. For example, a byref array of integers ("int[]&") has an element type of "int[]", which in turn has an element type of "int". This method makes it easier to find the root element type for any given .

member.exception: Thrown if either or is null.

member.name: T:Spackle.Extensions.DynamicBindingExtensions
member.summary: Provides a number of extension methods to support dynamic binding.
member.remarks: This code is based on the work done by leppie: http://www.twitter.com/leppie The original code can be found here. http://www.codeproject.com/KB/cs/dynamicbindingincsharp.aspx. Note that this implementation has been modified slightly. The author has graciously allowed the code to be included in Spackle.

member.summary: Moves all of the elements in in a certain direction.

member.param: The list to rotate elements in.
The direction in which the values should rotate.
member.exception: Thrown if is negative or larger than the number of elements in .
member.remarks: This code is based on the work presented here: http://eli.thegreenplace.net/2008/08/29/space-efficient-list-rotation/.

member.name: M:Spackle.Extensions.IListOfTExtensions.Shuffle``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0})
member.summary: Shuffles the given list.
member.typeparam: The type of the members in .
member.remarks: The implementation of Shuffle uses the Fisher–Yates shuffle, as implemented by Durstenfeld - see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fisher%E2%80%93Yates_shuffle for details on this implementation.

member.name: M:Spackle.Extensions.IListOfTExtensions.Shuffle``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Random)
member.summary: Shuffles the given list using the given generator.
member.typeparam: The type of the members in .
member.param: The random number generator to use.
member.remarks: The implementation of Shuffle uses the Fisher–Yates shuffle, as implemented by Durstenfeld - see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fisher%E2%80%93Yates_shuffle for details on this implementation.

member.summary: Swaps two values.
member.typeparam: The type of the members in .
member.param: The list to swap elements in.
An index value into the given list.
An index value into the given list.
member.exception: Throw if and/or are outside the bounds of the given list.
member.remarks: If and are equal, nothing is done to the given list.

member.name: M:Spackle.Reflection.Extensions.MethodBaseExtensions.GetParameterTypes(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Gets the types of the parameters for the given method.
member.param: The to get parameter types for.
member.returns: An array of s that map directly to the parameters (in terms of location) in the given method.
member.remarks: If is a or , no parameter type information can be determined, so the returned array will be empty.
